wikipedia_page.main:
Lt. Thomas Charles Jones (1 April 1901 – 19 July 1935) was a Welsh cricketer.  Jones was a left-handed batsman. He was born at Pontypool, Monmouthshire.
Jones made his first-class status debut for Glamorgan in 1925 against Somerset.  He played one further first-class match during that season against Gloucestershire.  His final first-class match for Glamorgan came against Warwickshire in 1928.  In his brief first-class career, he scored 36 runs at a batting average of 6.00 and a high score of 21.Outside of cricket, Jones was a lieutenant in the British Army, which limited his appearances in first-class cricket.  Jones died at Westminster, London on 19 July 1935.
